name: RunSqlServerScripts
description: Runs T-SQL scripts on a remote SQL Server database.
author: ggarbuglia

inputs.name: sourcepath
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The local folder where you have your scripts.

inputs.name: server
inputs.label: SQL Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server name you want to reach.

inputs.name: instance
inputs.label: SQL Instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server instance name you want to reach.

inputs.name: adminusr
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the remote machine.

inputs.name: adminpwd
inputs.label: Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the remote machine.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: dbname
inputs.label: Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The database name you want to reach.

inputs.name: dbpwd
inputs.label: Database Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the remote database.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: waitseconds
inputs.label: Wait (Seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The time in seconds between each script execution. Some times you need some space between executions to let the engine finish the script.
